sense.name: (cause to) fail or be unable to remember something
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1 FORGET NP2 NP1 FORGET COMP
sense.examples: I'm sorry, I've forgotten your name. Let me write down that date before I forget it. We'd forgotten that she doesn't come on Thrusdays. She would never forget seeing the Himalayas for the first time. I've forgotten how to do it. I never forget a face. I forgot to take the trash out. I forgot to attach the forms. I forgot to take my pills. I forgot to bring the disks with me. I forgot my umbrella. She forgot the disks at home.

sense.name: fail to give due attention to something or someone/lose control of manners or behavior
sense.examples: Don't forget your manners. For a moment he forgot himself, he forgot about the danger he was in as he stared in awe at the building. Oh dear, I'm forgetting myself!

sense.name: dismiss
sense.commentary: Includes: FORGET ABOUT Note: often is in imperative form
sense.examples: Forget about it! Forget about implementation, focus on results. Cashman can forget about a relaxing offseason. Forget your troubles, c'mon, get happy! I put on some good music and I just forgot everything else and started work. So we just forgot it and concentrated on boat speed and sail trim.
